title: Opening and Awards Ceremony

author: Donato Malerba, Department of Computer Science, University of Bari

segmentation: Well, easy MLP Kitty has a long history.

I said no way.
Please leave it as eml pickity because there's the slash was used before 2008 when we still were two different communities.
In some sense, running a joint conference.
This is a let me say you need unique example of integration of the two communities.
If you think to KDD or I, CML or ICBM just to mention the top conferences and the two areas of machine learning and data mining well.
We are not biased toward one or the two areas, so this is really a unique conference in its gender and this year we celebrated 10 years anniversary.
And indeed we have decided to give a 10 year DCML paper award, and the ceremony will take place on Wednesday.
And basically we have selected the paper.
Presented 10 years ago, which, according to a committee, has had the largest impact in the 10 in these ten years.
We have a full week schedule.
Today we started with.
Workshops weather tutorials.
We also started with the Discovery Challenge and we will have other additional tutorials and workshops on Friday and will also have an industrial session on Friday.
From Tuesday to Thursday, we will have a technical sessions.
We have 24 technical sessions and we also have a demo session.
We have a 6 plenary invited talks from internationally eminent researchers in machine learning and data mining and also in related areas, but not recognition or complex networks.
We will have Rakesh Agrawal.
From a Microsoft Research Labs Mountain View Albert Laszlo Barabasi from the Harvard University Christopher Bishop from Microsoft Research Labs Cambridge.

Of Helsinki, Finland.

Your account from Google Maps jury and Neil Cinder as an from.
EBay research labs.

So and we also have a several interesting work, but talks in the in the workshops, so they let me say that emphasized that the program is really very rich, so you certainly find something interesting in this conference.
And we had.
Nine 599 submissions to this conference, and we accepted in the end.
121 full papers and which will be presented in three parallel sessions and each paper will be will have 22 minutes to be presented.
Questions included.
So we thought that for the discussion it was better to organize also a poster reception which will take place tomorrow evening where.
All papers will have been invited to to to be presented, and we also selected 20 best papers for the two post conference this year.
Specially issues the post conference because we thought that in order to guarantee the high quality of the published papers on two well known.
Journals we needed more complete, a deeper reviewing process, so we have 10 papers for selected for machine learning Journal.
And then for the data mining and Knowledge Discovery Journal.
